Create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane: - Draw a rectangle by creating four lines: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.5] - Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.5], End Point [0.0, 0.5] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.5], End Point [0.0, 0.0] 3. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with the following properties: - Extrusion Depth Towards Normal: 0.125 - Extrusion Depth Opposite Normal: 0.0 - Sketch Scale: 0.75 - Operation: Create a new solid body Part 2: Creating a Cutout on the Prism Attach a smaller rectangular prism to the side of the larger prism and create a cutout. The smaller prism is approximately 0.5 units long, 0.5 units wide, and 0.025 units tall. 1. Create a new coordinate system with no rotation and a small translation in the positive Z direction: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.025, 0.0, 0.125] 2. Create a 2D sketch on a plane parallel to the X-Y plane: - Draw a smaller rectangle by creating four lines: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.0625, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.0625, 0.0], End Point [0.0625, 0.5] - Line 3: Start Point [0.0625, 0.5], End Point [0.0, 0.5] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.5], End Point [0.0, 0.0] - Draw a semicircle on the left side of the rectangle: - Arc 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.1417], Mid Point [0.0, 0.125], End Point [0.0, 0.0] - Draw a semicircle on the top side of the rectangle: - Arc 1: Start Point [0.4125, 0.5], Mid Point [0.375, 0.5], End Point [0.2875, 0.5] 3. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.5. 4. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the following transformations: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] 5. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with the following properties: - Extrusion Depth Towards Normal: 0.0 - Extrusion Depth Opposite Normal: 0.025 - Sketch Scale: 0.5 - Operation: Cut feature</description>
